intro: Canthium thyrsoideum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, with simple, alternate leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its inflorescence consists of cyathia, which are cup-shaped clusters containing a single female flower and several male flowers. Canthium thyrsoideum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including grasslands and forest edges.
